verses.verse: It <WH3130> happened <WH6651> at the <WH1250> end of two <WH2344> full years, <WH3220> that Pharaoh <WH3966> dreamed: <WH7235> and behold, <WH2308> he stood by the river. <WH5608>
Behold, <WH5927> there came up out of the river <WH2975> seven <WH7651> cattle, <WH6510> sleek <WH3303> and <WH4758> fat, <WH1277> and they fed <WH7462> in the marsh grass. <WH260>

Behold, <WH7651> seven other <WH312> cattle <WH6510> came up <WH5927> after them <WH310> out of the river, <WH2975> ugly <WH7451> and <WH4758> thin, <WH1851> and stood <WH5975> by <WH681> the other cattle <WH6510> on the brink <WH8193> of the river. <WH2975>
The ugly <WH7451> and <WH4758> thin <WH1851> cattle <WH6510> ate up <WH398> the seven <WH7651> sleek <WH3303> and <WH4758> fat <WH1277> cattle. <WH6510> So Pharaoh <WH6547> awoke. <WH3364>
He slept <WH3462> and dreamed <WH2492> a second time: <WH8145> and behold, <WH7651> seven heads of grain <WH7641> came up <WH5927> on one <WH259> stalk, <WH7070> healthy <WH1277> and good. <WH2896>
Behold, <WH7651> seven heads <WH7641> of grain, <WH1851> thin and blasted <WH7710> with the east wind, <WH6921> sprung up <WH6779> after them. <WH310>

The thin <WH1851> heads <WH7641> of grain swallowed <WH1104> up the seven <WH7651> healthy <WH1277> and full <WH4392> ears. <WH7641> Pharaoh <WH6547> awoke, <WH3364> and behold, <WH2472> it was a dream.

It happened in the morning <WH1242> that his spirit <WH7307> was troubled, <WH6470> and he sent <WH7971> and called <WH7121> for all of Egypt <WH4714>'s magicians <WH2748> and wise men. <WH2450> Pharaoh <WH6547> told <WH5608> them his dreams, <WH2472> but there was no one who could interpret <WH6622> them to Pharaoh. <WH6547>
Then the chief <WH8269> cupbearer <WH8248> spoke <WH1696> to Pharaoh, <WH6547> saying, <WH559> "I remember <WH2142> my faults <WH2399> today. <WH3117>

Pharaoh <WH6547> was angry <WH7107> with his servants, <WH5650> and put <WH5414> me in custody <WH4929> in the house <WH1004> of the captain <WH8269> of the guard, <WH2876> me and the chief <WH8269> baker. <WH644>
We dreamed <WH2492> a dream <WH2472> in one <WH259> night, <WH3915> I and he. <WH2492> We dreamed each man <WH376> according to the interpretation <WH6623> of his dream. <WH2472>

There was with us there a young man, <WH5288> a Hebrew, <WH5680> servant <WH5650> to the captain <WH8269> of the guard, <WH2876> and we told <WH5608> him, <WH6622> and he interpreted to us our dreams. <WH2472> To each man <WH376> according to his dream <WH2472> he interpreted. <WH6622>
It happened, <WH6622> as he interpreted to us, <WH7725> so it was: he restored me to my office, <WH3653> and he hanged him. <WH8518>"

Then Pharaoh <WH6547> sent <WH7971> and called <WH7121> Joseph, <WH3130> and they brought him hastily <WH7323> out of the dungeon. <WH953> He shaved <WH1548> himself, <WH2498> changed his clothing, <WH8071> and came in <WH935> to Pharaoh. <WH6547>

Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> "I have dreamed <WH2492> a dream, <WH2472> and there is no one who can interpret <WH6622> it. <WH8085> I have heard it said <WH559> of you, <WH8085> that when you hear a dream <WH2472> you can interpret it. <WH6622>"
Joseph <WH3130> answered <WH6030> Pharaoh, <WH6547> saying, <WH559> "It isn't <WH1107> in me. God <WH430> will give <WH6030> Pharaoh <WH6547> an answer <WH6030> of peace. <WH7965>"
Pharaoh <WH6547> spoke <WH1696> to Joseph, <WH3130> "In my dream, <WH2472> behold, <WH5975> I stood on the brink <WH8193> of the river: <WH2975>
and behold, <WH5927> there came up out of the river <WH2975> seven <WH7651> cattle, <WH6510> fat <WH1277> and <WH3303> sleek. <WH8389> They fed <WH7462> in the marsh grass, <WH260>

and behold, <WH7651> seven other <WH312> cattle <WH6510> came up <WH5927> after them, <WH310> poor <WH1803> and very <WH3966> ugly <WH7451> and <WH8389> thin, <WH7534> such <WH2007> as I never <WH3808> saw <WH7200> in all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> for ugliness. <WH7455>
The thin <WH7534> and ugly <WH7451> cattle <WH6510> ate up <WH398> the first <WH7223> seven <WH7651> fat <WH1277> cattle, <WH6510>
and when they had eaten them up, <WH935> it couldn't <WH3045> be known that they had eaten them, <WH935> but they were still <WH4758> ugly, <WH7451> as at the beginning. <WH8462> So I awoke. <WH3364>
I saw <WH7200> in my dream, <WH2472> and behold, <WH7651> seven heads <WH7641> of grain came up <WH5927> on one <WH259> stalk, <WH7070> full <WH4392> and good: <WH2896>
and behold, <WH7651> seven heads <WH7641> of grain, <WH6798> withered, thin, <WH1851> and blasted <WH7710> with the east wind, <WH6921> sprung up <WH6779> after them. <WH310>

The thin <WH1851> heads <WH7641> of grain swallowed <WH1104> up the seven <WH7651> good <WH2896> heads <WH7641> of grain. <WH559> I told it to the magicians, <WH2748> but there was no one who could explain it to me. <WH5046>"
Joseph <WH3130> said <WH559> to Pharaoh, <WH6547> "The dream <WH2472> of Pharaoh <WH6547> is one. <WH259> What God <WH430> is about to do <WH6213> he has declared <WH5046> to Pharaoh. <WH6547>

The seven <WH7651> good <WH2896> cattle <WH6510> are seven <WH7651> years; <WH8141> and the seven <WH7651> good <WH2896> heads <WH7641> of grain are seven <WH7651> years. <WH8141> The dream <WH2472> is one. <WH259>

The seven <WH7651> thin <WH7534> and ugly <WH7451> cattle <WH6510> that came up <WH5927> after them <WH310> are seven <WH7651> years, <WH8141> and also the seven <WH7651> empty <WH7386> heads <WH7641> of grain blasted <WH7710> with the east wind; <WH6921> they will be seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of famine. <WH7458>
That is the thing <WH1697> which I spoke <WH1696> to Pharaoh. <WH6547> What God <WH430> is about to do <WH6213> he has shown <WH7200> to Pharaoh. <WH6547>
Behold, <WH935> there come seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of great <WH1419> plenty <WH7647> throughout all the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>

There will arise <WH6965> after them <WH310> seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of famine, <WH7458> and all the plenty <WH7647> will be forgotten <WH7911> in the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714> The famine <WH7458> will consume <WH3615> the land, <WH776>
and the plenty <WH7647> will not be known <WH3045> in the land <WH776> by reason <WH6440> of that famine <WH7458> which follows; <WH310> for it will be very <WH3966> grievous. <WH3515>

The dream <WH2472> was doubled <WH8138> to <WH6471> Pharaoh, <WH6547> because the thing <WH1697> is established <WH3559> by <WH5973> God, <WH430> and God <WH430> will shortly <WH4116> bring it to pass. <WH6213>
"Now therefore let Pharaoh <WH6547> look for <WH7200> a discreet <WH995> and wise <WH2450> man, <WH376> and set <WH7896> him over the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>

Let Pharaoh <WH6547> do <WH6213> this, <WH6485> and let him appoint overseers over the land, <WH776> and take up the fifth part <WH2567> of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>'s produce in the seven <WH7651> plenteous <WH7647> years. <WH8141>

Let them gather <WH6908> all the food <WH400> of these good <WH2896> years <WH8141> that come, <WH935> and lay up <WH6651> grain <WH1250> under the hand <WH3027> of Pharaoh <WH6547> for food <WH400> in the cities, <WH5892> and let them keep it. <WH8104>

The food <WH400> will be for a store <WH6487> to the land <WH776> against the seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of famine, <WH7458> which will be in the land <WH776> of Egypt; <WH4714> that the land <WH776> not perish <WH3772> through the famine. <WH7458>"
The thing <WH1697> was good <WH3190> in the eyes <WH5869> of Pharaoh, <WH6547> and in the eyes <WH5869> of all his servants. <WH5650>
Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> to his servants, <WH5650> "Can we find <WH4672> such a one as this, <WH2088> a man <WH376> in whom <WH834> is the Spirit <WH7307> of God? <WH430>"
Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> "Because <WH310> God <WH430> has shown <WH3045> you all of this, <WH995> there is none so discreet and wise as you. <WH2450>
You shall be <WH1961> over my house, <WH1004> and according to your word <WH6310> will all my people <WH5971> be ruled. <WH5401> Only in the throne <WH3678> I will be greater than you. <WH1431>"
Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> "Behold, <WH7200> I have set <WH5414> you over all the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>"

Pharaoh <WH6547> took off <WH5493> his signet ring <WH2885> from his hand, <WH3027> and put <WH5414> it on Joseph <WH3130>'s hand, <WH3027> and arrayed <WH6440> him in robes <WH899> of fine linen, <WH8336> and put <WH7760> a gold <WH2091> chain <WH7242> about his neck, <WH6677>

and he made him to ride <WH7392> in the second <WH4932> chariot <WH4818> which he had. <WH7121> They cried before him, <WH6440> "Bow the knee! <WH86>" He set him <WH6440> over all the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>

Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> "I am Pharaoh, <WH6547> and without <WH1107> you shall no man <WH376> lift up <WH7311> his hand <WH3027> or his foot <WH7272> in all the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>"

Pharaoh <WH6547> called <WH7121> Joseph <WH3130>'s name <WH8034> Zaphenath-Paneah; <WH6847> and he gave <WH5414> him Asenath, <WH621> the daughter <WH1323> of Potiphera <WH6319> priest <WH3548> of On <WH204> as a wife. <WH802> Joseph <WH3130> went out <WH3318> over the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>

Joseph <WH3130> was thirty <WH7970> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he stood <WH5975> before <WH6440> Pharaoh <WH6547> king <WH4428> of Egypt. <WH4714> Joseph <WH3130> went out <WH3318> from the presence <WH6440> of Pharaoh, <WH6547> and went throughout <WH5674> all the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>
In the seven <WH7651> plenteous <WH7647> years <WH8141> the earth <WH776> produced <WH6213> abundantly. <WH7062>

He gathered up <WH6908> all the food <WH400> of the seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> which were in the land <WH776> of Egypt, <WH4714> and laid up <WH5414> the food <WH400> in the cities: <WH5892> the food <WH400> of the field, <WH7704> which was around <WH5439> every city, <WH5892> he laid up <WH5414> in the same. <WH8432>

Joseph <WH3130> laid <WH6651> up grain <WH1250> as the sand <WH2344> of the sea, <WH3220> very <WH3966> much, <WH7235> until he stopped <WH2308> counting, <WH5608> for it was without <WH369> number. <WH4557>

To Joseph <WH3130> were born <WH3205> two <WH8147> sons <WH1121> before the year <WH8141> of famine <WH7458> came, <WH935> whom Asenath, <WH621> the daughter <WH1323> of Potiphera <WH6319> priest <WH3548> of On, <WH204> bore to him. <WH3205>

Joseph <WH3130> called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of the firstborn <WH1060> Manasseh, <WH4519> "For, <WH430>" he said, "God has made me forget <WH5382> all my toil, <WH5999> and all my father <WH1>'s house. <WH1004>"
The name <WH8034> of the second, <WH8145> he called <WH7121> Ephraim: <WH669> "For God <WH430> has made me fruitful <WH6509> in the land <WH776> of my affliction. <WH6040>"
The seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of plenty, <WH7647> that were in the land <WH776> of Egypt, <WH4714> came to an end. <WH3615>

The seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> of famine <WH7458> began <WH2490> to come, <WH935> just as Joseph <WH3130> had said. <WH559> There was famine <WH7458> in all lands, <WH776> but in all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> there was bread. <WH3899>

When all the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> was famished, <WH7456> the people <WH5971> cried <WH6817> to Pharaoh <WH6547> for bread, <WH3899> and Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> to all the Egyptians, <WH4714> "Go <WH3212> to Joseph. <WH3130> What he says <WH559> to you, <WH6213> do."

The famine <WH7458> was over all the surface <WH6440> of the earth. <WH776> Joseph <WH3130> opened <WH6605> all the store houses, <WH7666> and sold to the Egyptians. <WH4714> The famine <WH7458> was severe <WH2388> in the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>
All countries <WH776> came <WH935> into Egypt, <WH4714> to Joseph, <WH3130> to buy <WH7666> grain, <WH7458> because the famine was severe <WH2388> in all the earth. <WH776>
